page.title: 10THE PEBBLE MILL HOUSE
page.content: From January to April 1985 the B.B.C. in their programme, Pebble Mill at One, featured the repair and renovation of a pre-war, three bedroomed semi-detached house .79, Damson Lane was to be transformed into a luxury show house. The house was purchased by a local estate agent for Â£18,750, well below market price. The house was in a poor state of repair and the garden needed attention. The agents financed the project and the B.B.C. televised each stage of the work. When the work was completed the house was put up for sale-Â£34,500. The public were allowed to look around the show house and many from all over the midlands came. The house has been sold but has remained empty up to July 1985.
